From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From en- +‎ loco +‎ -ecer.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /enlokeˈθeɾ/ [ẽn.lo.keˈθeɾ] (Spain)
  • IPA(key): /enlokeˈseɾ/ [ẽn.lo.keˈseɾ] (Latin America, Philippines)
  • Rhymes: -eɾ
  • Syllabification: en‧lo‧que‧cer

Verb

[edit]

enloquecer (first-person singular present enloquezco, first-person singular preterite enloquecí, past participle enloquecido)

  1. (transitive) to drive crazy, madden, drive insane, distract
    Synonyms: volver loco, trastornar
  2. (intransitive, sometimes pronominal) to go crazy, to go nuts, to go insane, to go wild
    Synonym: volverse loco
    Si realmente estás pensando en volver a aquel lugar sucio, debes haberte enloquecido totalmente.
    If you're really thinking about going back to that filthy place, you must have gone totally crazy.
  3. (reflexive) to go crazy
  4. (reflexive) to run amok

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
